content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --LNKGRP
      operator: value_does_not_have_multiple_references
      value: $VALUE_COUNTS
    - name: --LNKGRP
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0022
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Verify that an --LNKGRP value specified in one domain is also present
  in the  --LNKGRP variable in another domain
Operations:
  - id: $VALUE_COUNTS
    name: --LNKGRP
    operator: variable_value_count
Outcome:
  Message: A value specified in --LNKGRP variable is not found in any of the other
    submitted domains.
  Output Variables:
    - --LNKGRP
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0022
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: --LNKGRP is a grouping identifier used to identify
                  a group of records in one domain that is related to a record in
                  another domain, often forming a many-to-one relationship.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: 2.E.2
                Section: 4.2.6
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Verify that an --LNKGRP value specified in one domain is also present in the  --LNKGRP variable in another domain

Outcome.Message: A value specified in --LNKGRP variable is not found in any of the other submitted domains.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: --LNKGRP is a grouping identifier used to identify a group of records in one domain that is related to a record in another domain, often forming a many-to-one relationship.
